samples.situation: How can I cope with losing my boyfriend to another woman?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Hi, I'm coping with losing my boyfriend to another woman and can't deal.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I am sorry to hear that. You deserve better

prefix_dialog.content: How about treating yourself to nice relaxing bath and good book ?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: That sounds wonderful.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: You should focus on yourself and remember you are a amazing woman!

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: If you are sure you are ready for it then No. However make sure you dont judge them by previous relationships.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I have to think about it more but I am lonely already

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I understand but wouldnt you rather be alone and focusing on yourself instead of miserable relationship?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I am thinking of pursuing a new relationship and hoping to move forward

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I think that would be a wonderful idea for you.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That sounds really difficult. How did you find out about this possibility?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I'm not sure how reliable the source is, but I overheard a conversation that made it sound like he is seeing someone.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: Even without knowing all the details, it's clear that he was never really committed to you.

prefix_conversation.content: I would certainly agree with you. That kind of work is unsustainable. Let me ask you this. What would happen if you told your employer you simply could not do these hours?

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: The worst that could happen is that they fire you. But that doesn't seem too likely as they seem to need you. But I have learned in life that if I don't care for myself, hardly anyone does. We need to be kind to ourselves. Set boundaries.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: agreed - i dont think they would fire me, maybe get reprimanded or more likely a guilt trip as to why I cant do it. Im just not sure what kind of boundaries I set when we have things due, and just literally no time.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Setting boundaries can be difficult if you haven't done that a lot. When we think we don't have the ability to say NO, then we feel trapped, worn out, depressed, taken advantage of. People need to know that we reasonably can say no.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Well, I have to set boundaries, because working till 11pm most nights is not sustainable. and who on earth is going to view, let alone sign a contract at 12am

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I think that would be the first step. Determine how many hours you feel you COULD work. Then advise them that is what you will do. Find out what kind of timelines there are, and if you can't do it, don't go beyond your boundaries. It is obviously destroying your life. It really isn't healthy for you.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Exactly. It isn't working for you. Something has to change. And you sound intelligent, so you can determine what will work for you -- perhaps a range of hours, but definitely not 14 hours. Unless you are a young kid. lol Even then, that's a lot.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: yeah - ill come up with reasonable boundaries till 5:30 is reasonable, and if its a do or die situation cap it at 7:30 --- and thats only for dire situations. if that doesnt work, well then i guess either i dont have a job, or people figure out how to work in regular hours.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: That sounds reasonable to me. And if they try to make you feel guilty, reject that. Tell them, I'm sorry, but I feel this is reasonable, and truly it is.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: What are you currently studying?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I am studying microbiology. I do not know that I have the passion for it that I once did though.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Your motivation and how you are studying is probably related, you are right. What attracted you to microbiology in the first place?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I have always found it fascinating and have an uncle who is a microbiologist. But these days I feel I made the wrong decision. Is it too late to change?

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: It is never too late to change anything. However, i hear that you have always found it fascinating,have you considered talking to your uncle and seeing if you can find what you loved about it again?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Yes that does sound like good advice. I do not want to turn by back on my studies of the past years. But my grades are really poor and I am not sure what to do about that.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Studying can be really difficult , especially when you are half way through. i struggled in my studies and found that talking to my tutors helped and approaching student support. Have you tried anything like that or has your motivation held you back?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: To be honest I have been a little afraid to approach them about the subject because they might accuse me of just slacking. I know it might look like that from the outside.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Just from chatting to you, I can sense that you are anxious, however, as many students feel this way, they will have a whole lot of help they can provide.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I do feel that part of my problem is that I am afraid to really open up about it. You are the first person I have really felt able to talk to.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I am pleased that you have been able to open up to me, it is the first step towards you finding your path. Do you find it easy to write things down?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Yes, it is really much more easy to write my problems down than to actually talk to people about them face to face.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: One suggestion is for you to write down all the reasons that you love microbiology. It can be any format, I love a bubble chart (mind map), it could be in list form or just doodles, would this be something you would find useful?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Yes, that is a fantastic idea! Maybe I can find a renewed interest in the subject. I hope that I can because I really do not want my time studying to have been wasted.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: It would be a really good place to start. Then you could be really kind to yourself and take some pressure off. Would you like to talk through some ideas to help with the work itself?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Yes I really would. I already feel more motivated! Half an hour ago I felt that I had no place left to go and felt defeated.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: That's really good, sometimes it is about finding a direction and small steps. Often when we are studying the work seems really big, especially essay questions. One thing that helped me was to break it into really small chunks, sometimes physically covering up some of the question. Would that be something that would help?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I have not really tried it but I ought to. I often feel that I am just overwhelmed. Then I know that I got something wrong for definite and I just want to give up.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: It could be something you can try, remember , it is not always about ought to, simply how can I make it easier for myself. It is okay to get things wrong too. If you decide to write your list of reasons why you love microbiology, maybe you could keep it in a place you see every day, a mirror or fridge and keep seeing where you are trying to get to.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: When I get stuck in that loop, I try to change up my entire physical situation -- take a shower or a soak, change up my music if I'm listening to it.  Kind of force my brain to take in a change.

prefix_conversation.content: I tried, I tried to keep myself busy, but boom my depressions hits me like a brick wall.

prefix_conversation.content: You should definitely see if the doctor can adjust your meds, I have ended up on a completely different type of medication than the one I tried first.  But I understand.  I think you should try getting out of the house and enjoying fresh air and physical activity.  It won't cure your depression but it may help your headspace and your point of view.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: What kind of hobbies do you have?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I'm teaching myself the piano.  I'm also teaching myself  how to work a stenography machine for possible future employment as a stenographer.  I also like to read novels.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I have never understood how those work..I find it amazing someone can type out whole words or sentences with one word

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yeah, it's pretty cool.  For example, if I hit DRAT in one stroke, then "Did there come a time" will appear in English on my machine's  LCD screen.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter

This dictionary is present within the actual steno machine after you transfer it from your laptop to the machine via cable or wifi.  Thus your machine then knows how you write out words in particular and how to translate those words from steno to English - each stenographer writes a little differently.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: OK that makes sense, so you basically program it as the user. I take it your stenography machine becomes pretty close to you lol

samples.situation: I've recently lost my job due to the covid situation and my funds are dwindling by the day while we've been out into another lockdown

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Hi, i've been feeling really depressed lately and I'd like to talk to someone about it

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: That is very understandable.  Depression is tough to deal with.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Do you have specific things that are causing you sadness right now or is it an overall feeling of being sad?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: It's a bit of everything. I've recently lost my job and I'm just really worried about how my bills are going to get paid. I feel so tired, you know?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I totally understand.  Losing your job is a very rough thing to go through, I'm sorry that happened to you.  Feeling constantly at red alert is taxing both mentally and physically.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: There is a concept called Maslow's hierarchy of needs, and sometimes I find it useful to think about if my needs are being met, and which is lacking.  Which is to say, obviously financial security is your primary need at the moment, but there are other needs you must attend to as well, including your physical comforts.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: In times of great stress and upheaval, there is only so much you can do.  The rest is worry, a hamster running in a wheel, a huge output of energy that does nothing at all.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yeah that makes sense but I've spent so much time thinking about my finances that I've sort of burned myself out

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Like I have no energy even to be thankful for the other little stuff

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: That makes sense.  You sound emotionally exhausted.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Definitely, I feel like I could sleep forever but with my kids to worry about I don't have that option

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Gratitude is one of those things, I've found, that is self-perpetuating.  Even if you begin by doing it robotically, eventually your mind and heart will want to be more sincerely grateful.  I have in the past challenged myself to find five things to be grateful for in the morning and write them down.  Whether those things are "I have hot coffee and electricity" or "I won $1000 for free", they will begin to start a small fire of joy.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Messages could work, I could stick them around and I guess they coudl help not just me but my little ones too because I'm sure my moods been affecting them as well

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: That sounds like a great idea!  It sounds like you care a lot about your kids, I bet it's easy for you to be grateful for them :-)

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Also, I've started to notice that my kids are picking up on my stress. Theyve been a bit more clingy and worried themselves.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That must be hard for you as a parent to see. It sounds like your emotional state is having an impact on them, which is very common.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Yeah, I try to put on a brave face for them, but its tough. I just want to make sure they feel secure.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: It's great that you're so mindful of their feelings. Have you thought about finding small ways to spend quality time with them, even during this stressful time?

samples.situation: I keep trying to get started, but my kitchen mess seems so overwhelming.

samples.situation: I am very scare of this pandemic call COVID-19

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I am really afraid here I don't know what to do

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: As for the pandemic, if you know no one who has died, I wouldn't worry about it. The CDC has no reported deaths of anyone healthy. People who are unhealthy die, not the healthy, and people who are sick ALREADY are the ones who die. If you are relatively healthy, then you are good to go. Do things to protect your health. What are you eating? What are you drinking? Are you talking to friends and getting social life? Are you getting fresh air? Thinking good thoughts?  Or are you living in fear when you are not going to a lot of funerals.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: It is well documented that our immune system is affected by our mental state, so it is important that you care for your health. Focusing on the negativity of the pandemic will bring you down. Focusing on being healthy and taking care of your mind, soul, spirit and body will help build up your immunity and make you strong.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I don't like the noise of ambulance at all any time I see one I don't feel happy

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I can understand an ambulance sound is hard to hear, but even that can be turned around. You can pray for the person, then switch your mind off. If you focus on the negative, you will stay negative. If you do what you can (pray) then there is nothing else to do. Focusing on the negative will depress you.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: One thing I did to help with depression is keep a checklist of things to do when I felt down:  call a friend, call a loved one to encourage THEM, go for a walk, eat fruits and veggies, read a book, go for a bike ride, etc.  Things like that, then I chose to do those things despite how I felt. Doing those things helped my mood TREMENDOUSLY>

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Feelings follow thoughts. If you think negative thoughts, you will feel negative. If you think positive thoughts, you will feel positive. Sometimes this takes time, but it works.  Just because you feel sad doesn't mean you should just do nothing, a person can TALK their way out of sadness and choose to do something different.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Thanks your words of encouraging help me a lot

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I am glad you were able to talk about how this is affecting you. I think many people are affected. And I encourage you to really do things you like and enjoy to keep your mood better. If you feel down, talk about it, pray about it but do NOT dwell on it, because that will bring you down.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Sometimes we get in a funk, when we do, we can pull ourselves out, I do suggest you write a list of things to do and put on the frige.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: You are very correct I like you a lot

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Thank you, how very sweet!  I do thank you for sharing your life with me. I'm an older person and this has affected me too.  Life is full of ups and downs, so I've been through some rough times. You can do this! :D

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Also, I've been trying to go for walks more often to clear my mind and feel better.

generated_dialog.content: That's a great step! Walking can really help lift your mood and reduce stress. How have those walks been for you?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker

generated_dialog.content: It's completely normal to feel that way. Maybe you could try walking during quieter times when there are fewer people around. That could help you feel more comfortable.
